name: auspicious
description:
A Crowther design this volumous Catamaran is in excellent condition and beautifully presented. She was built to 1D and 2C NSW survey requirements and launched in 2000.  Auspicious has sailed NSW – QLD – NT – WA with extended Kimberley and Gulf cruising as well as offshore to Indonesia recently thanks to her Australian registration. 
The generous dimensions of the hull mouldings allow space and comfort to be maintained with 1.9m headroom in the four double/queen cabins and two heads. The galley-up includes Broadwater Marine Gas Stove + Oven, Icier deep freeze + 150 litre fridge and Microwave. Wrap around Leather lounges are the feature of the Saloon which includes timber dining table and great vista through expansive windows. The huge Cockpit area is self-draining with large drain grates at each corner and full hardtop, shades and rain covers over cockpit ensure comfort whatever the weather. Large Gas outdoor BBQ cooking with sink and transom shower. Excellent helm seat is positioned high for good visibility and control, cockpit area has seating for 10. 
Separate engine rooms house the Yanmar diesels and solid davits on the stern for the aluminium dinghy. This is a big roomy Cat that has huge forward lockers on deck with capacity for almost 2000ltrs water if you don’t want to use the water maker. Comes with hooker diving gear for hull cleaning and your reef snorkelling and she is totally equipped for offshore cruising, just load up and Go! 
Please contact the listing broker Kelvin Gorrie on +61 (0) 430 941 585 for more information, or to book your inspection.

This cruising/performance catamaran has just been completely redone inside and out. She functions equally well as a motor catamaran and a sail cat. A minimum draft of .65m permits ease of anchoring and premium beach location that similar catamarans just can't match. 
Each hull has a single forward cabin, a queen size mid ship cabin and a head / shower in the stern.  The heads are electric.  The bridge deck has a seating / dining area that converts to a double berth and a galley with a stainless sink and appliances including a large fridge, freezer and ample storage area throughout. List price is approximate Thai Baht.

Bimini tissu récent sur fly. Taud de fermeture arrière. Sellerie de salon de cockpit très bon état. Electronique complète : pilote automatique, radar, centrale Raymarine avec écrans tactiles au poste de barre et à la table à cartes, GPS GARMIN 720 tactile, bidata Raymarine, VHF fixe aux 2 postes. AIS émetteur-récepteur. Panneaux solaires sur bossoirs. Annexe semi-rigide et moteur HB 9,9CV récents. Survie container 8 places de 2016.

name: monatao
description:
OWNER WANTS QUICK SALE! 
The Lagoon 410 S2 is one of the most successful cruising catamarans and has stayed very popular.  With a 360 degree view from the saloon and surprising volume in the hulls, it’s a comfortable cruiser that still gives good sailing performance.  The weight is centred (engines set forward) and all sheets and halyards lead back to the helming station, complete with electric winch, making for easy manoeuvring. 
“Manatao” is the 4 cabin 4 bathroom version, perfect for sailing with family and friends or for charter operation.  She’s been well maintained with new anchor chain and anti-fouling and engine servicing done in 2018.  The sails are 6 years old, with full batten mainsail and genoa + spinnaker.  The standing rigging is original and the tridata screen will need replacing in the medium term.  Based in Moorea, with no access to quayside cleaning, the boat would benefit from some love and attention.  
In all, a good boat at an excellent price.

name: soul sacrifice
description: Soul Sacrifice, a 2003 Grainger 43 located at Kota Kinabalu (Malaysian Borneo), is now proudly and exclusively for sale with team YOTI Queensland. She is an Australian tax paid vessel. This is a great opportunity to buy a serious blue water cruising catamaran, with big ticket renewals of engines, sails a rigging already done! Of course, she comes with a Generator (6kw) water maker, good size freezer and washing machine ready to continue exploring even the remotest islands and locations. Soul Sacrifice was built by Ian Snell in Victoria and launched and commissioned in 2003. Her construction is of western red cedar and fiberglass. She has four cabins and two heads, with the galley midships in the starboard hull. The saloon has good size opening forward hatches for that important airflow. The navigation/electronics island is to port, and a large L shaped settee with table to starboard. All upholstery on Soul Sacrifice was replaced last year. The port forward cabin has a Queen size bed, overhead hatch, plenty storage cupboards and compartments. Forward of this cabin is separate large general storage locker (perfect for all the cruising gear) and water tight collision bulkhead. The starboard forward cabin also has a Queen-size bed, overhead hatch, plenty storage and an ensuite head and shower. There is additional storage forward of the shower water tight collision bulkhead. Midships in the port hull is a head and shower, accessible from both the front and rear side, making it also the guest/ day head. The port rear cabin is currently used for storage. This may be easily changed back to a regular double berth cabin. The Starboard aft cabin is converted into a utility space with the essentials for blue water cruising: a 6kw generator, 7kg front loader washing machine and 80ltr freezer. The large cockpit had a recent upgrade with a hard top with solar panels and has twin helm stations, with controls and plotter at the port helm. Mainsheet, genoa and screecher sheets are controlled from the cockpit and the mainsail hoisted and reefed at the mast. Her decks are uncluttered, with ample space for your SUP or kayaksThe transoms have clear access to and from the cockpit and the large stainless-steel arch functions as davits for the tender, with top mounted solar panels. Please contact Robert Vrind for further details on this great blue water cruising catamaran yacht, and to arrange an early inspection in Malaysia. (Kota Kinabalu International airport via Singapore or Kuala Lumpur).

Not too many catamarans this size on this conditions at this price 4 Cabins 2 heads , no hurricane damage, everything works , extensive inventory on board :new sails (Doyle) , new running rigging, new dinghy , new electronics , new life raft , diving gear and safety equipment.(everything stays onboard). 
Really good opportunity here!!

name: extreme 40
description: Significant price reduction - serious seller This Marstrom Composites Extreme 40 is a serious 40 foot carbon fibre racing catamaran which was developed for various racing series and this particular yacht has been a very successful contender (ex SAP boat). The yacht does come with the lake upgrade package which is worth in the region of €40,000 and includes various sail upgrades such as a huge genakker (136m2), reacher (116m2) only used for 10 days, main sail 6sq metres larger than the original and various other sail setups and ancillary equipment. Over the years the equipment has been developed and modified to make handling easier such as carbon fibre towers which allows the whole daggerboards to be lifted from the water. The list of upgrades and additional equipment is extensive and too much to list here but is available on inquiry. This is a fast yacht, capable of speeds in excess of 35 kn. and very responsive even in light winds. The yacht can sail under the original X40 class rules as each of the new parts is removable. Please note that the trailer is not included in the sale.

name: shiloh
description:
Shiloh is easily boarded from either of the "Sugar Scoops" up to the aft deck with large table for at least 6 and cushioned seating. 
Entry into the salon through the glass large sliding door reveals a spacious and well-lit interior with an almost panoramic view, and great visibility. 
The galley is to port and well equipped as are the double sinks and dish drain. The large fridge is on the other side of the easy access stairs from the galley. Looking forward to starboard is the large salon table with room for at least 6. Just to starboard of the table is the Navigations center and electrical panels. 
From there we take the easy steps into the starboard. The aft cabin is used as a work and storage place. Going forward the full head is to the left with sink and shower. Forward of the head is the starboard stateroom with hanging locker. 
We then go to the port hull an ample head and shower are in the center of the hull with the port stateroom aft of that and another stateroom forward with storage and lockers. 
The helm station on the Lavezzi 40 is efficient and comfortable. A small windshield provides some shelter without obstructing vision, and all the controls operate smoothly. While the sheets do not all lead directly to the helm, it's only a short walk to reach the double-ended mainsheet or the genoa sheets. 
It's easy to enter and leave the expansive cockpit, and the decks are wide with good handholds alongside the cabin. Big lockers forward will swallow the dock lines and fenders, and the anchor windlass can double as a power winch for raising the mainsail. 
Fountaine Pajot has extensive experience in voyaging catamarans, and the Lavezzi 40 shows that heritage. This is a substantial cruiser with good performance and spacious accommodations. 
The Fountaine Pajot LAVEZZI 40 offers excellent performance at sea, with awesome stability and a generous sail plan. Genoa winches positioned to keep the cockpit clear and open with ease of single hand maneuverability. Great under power or sail.

Owners version!

name: makara
description: Makaras owners had successfully circumnavigated in another catamaran some years ago, and chose the Lavezzi for their new adventure because of its outstanding sailing capabilities, especially in light winds compared to other catamarans of this size, and its comfortable salon and cockpit layout with good forward vision without the need for a flybridge. Makara benefits from many recent upgrades,including new engines, new sail-drives, and Flexofold 3 blade (best-of-breed) folding props. Her sailing capabilities have been enhanced by a new 6 batten mainsail, new genoa, and new Code 0 head-sail on a sprit. She has also been rerigged. Electrical upgrades include new networked NMEA2000 instrumentation including AIS, Radar and autopilot, two large solar arrays (900w), one array on an alloy arch that also supports a kayak, and one on the cabin-top, These feed a large golf cart battery bank (800 Ahr) and a highly efficient Spectra watermaker.

name: lady freben
description:
FINALLY !  ONE OF  THE BEST DEALS AROUND!!! 
  
A very  lightly chartered and very well kept example of one of these sought after cats. 
Easily the cleanest one available. ORIGINALLY by house proud Canadian marine professionals who use her as their  winter home  ( and to prevent boredom) their crewed charter vessel for 5 months of the year....averaging one charter a month... mainly with friends and charter  clients from  back home. 
Then we sold her to a Boston based Doctor who uses her for his family and friends and now that his family is getting bigger he wants a bigger boat! 
  
She has had her FP warranted bottom job done some years ago. 
She represents excellent value for the discerning cruiser  looking for a clean well kept vessel to either putter around the islands  on or do some serious blue water cruising. 
BROKERS COMMENTS: 
  
We think this vessel represents a rare opportunity to acquire probably the best kept vessel of her type available today. When we tell you why, we think you will agree with us. 
  
1)      Pretty much all of these four cabin Lavezzi’s and similar vessels ( Lagoon 410’s etc) were built for the charter market. 
  
2)      They have been very successful. By 'successful' read “well used”….. Around 20 to 25 charter weeks a year. 
  
3)      For seven years this means an average of 175 charter weeks all driven by charter ' credit card' captains / one week warriors with varying skills levels and thus the bulk of these vessels have had hard lives. 
  
4)      They are ‘phased out’ after their charter lives when most charter companies  just give  the bulk of them them a lick and prayer of varnish and  repairs  and they are sold on. Some of the vessels are properly phased out and repaired by some of the companies…. To be sure. They have however still had their 175 weeks of charter. 
  
5)       These vessels have had an average of 5 to 10 days a year out of the water when they have their annual bottom paint and repairs done. Time out of the water is far more expensive than time in the water on a mooring/dock…. Thus charter companies cut costs and increase profitability for themselves and the owners by minimizing this hard standing time. It averages a max of just under 2% of their lives out of the water. Clearly not good for any glassfibre hull. Few of these ever had the benefit of additional barrier coating. 
  
This vessel  was only ever in a charter fleet for three years of her life…. Far less than the average Charter company contract of 4 to 5  years… (and then into a second and third tier discount  fleets for the rest of their lives from whence they are sold.) 
  
She was bought at three years old by her previous owners ,  picky marine professionals from Canada who have a small charter company there. She is used as their winter getaway in the islands where they do around five  crewed charters  a year only. Every single hurricane season she has been hauled ( only with a travel lift… never a crane) and stored on the hard for the entire summer, whilst they return to reopen their Canadian operation. 
  
So she has benefited from the personal loving care of  these long term marine professional owners who have never let anyone else captain her…. And it really does show. 
The new owner Doctor David bought her and took her North where she has been his summer Joy . 
His family is expanding and he wants a bigger boat! 
She has been constantly upgraded and  now awaits her new owners to live on and nurture her. 
  
  
  
  
 Will you be the lucky one?

name: arearea
description:
The owner of this Lavezzi 40 is a serious seaman who has circumnavigated on his 60 foot Wharram and he has sailed half way around the world on his current Catana 58. He arrived in the Marshall Islands and fell in love with the island and her people and has involved himself in a range of humanitarian projects in the region. Arearea was purchased by him five years ago for use on a project that was recently cancelled, hence the reason for her sale. Prior to that cancellation the seller invested heavily in her with a number of refits as you can see in our listing. 
She is being offered for sale on the island of Majuro, Marshall Islands. For the adventurous type, she can be purchased here and then sailed in almost any direction. But the seller of the boat can offer a pre-fix delivery price for people on his team to deliver her almost anywhere on her own bottom. A buyer could enjoy an island hop sail to Tarawa in Kiribati, then to Funafuti in Tuvalu, then on to Fiji, etc. Or a West Coast U.S. buyer could sail her to Hawaii and then on over to California, Oregon, or Washington state. The Lavezzi 40 is capable of making such sails and the boat is well equipped to do so. She is certainly an ideal purchase for anyone who wants a boat in the South Pacific islands, Guam, Fiji, or then on down to New Caledonia, New Zealand, or Australia.  
Please contact us with any questions. The seller of the boat is a longtime customer of ours and a good friend. He is a pleasure to deal with. She can he hauled and surveyed where she is, but advance notice will be required for us to have her out of the water for such an inspection. The nearest accredited surveyor is on the island of Guam and a buyer would have to fly him in, or of course any surveyor of their choice.  
The price for this catamaran, for her age, low hours, condition and equipment is excellent and has already been discounted to reflect her remote location.
Charter boat well maintained, ready to sail now.

This 40 foot cruising/performance catamaran functions equally well as a motor catamaran and a sailor with the unique feature of an automated power lift to completely raise her twin engines to draw to a minimum of .65m, permitting ease of anchoring and premium beach location that similar catamarans just can't match. 
Each hull has a single forward cabin, a queen size mid ship cabin and a head / shower in the stern.  The heads are electric and are connected to a Sani-Loo disposal system.  The bridge deck has a seating / dining area that converts to a double berth and a galley with a stainless sink and appliances including a large fridge, freezer and ample storage area throughout. 
Installed is a complete Raymarine instrumentation system with a wide screen display that can be viewed from either of the dual helms for maximum viewing and safety underway including new AIS, VHF and autopilot. 
There is an Echopilot, forward scan sonar system, useful for navigating shallow anchorages and a solid 20kg anchor with 60m of chain and 50m of rode, on a Maxwell power windlass local or by remote control for that skipper short on crew. 
Electrical system has 400Ah of AGM batteries that are charged from 2 large davit mounted solar panels and the dual auxiliary engines on a hydraulic raising system for reduced drag and fast passage making under sail. 
There is a beefy battened mainsail with two reef points and a comprehensive suite of sails with a screecher and jib for upwind sailing and two asymmetric spinnakers for extremely fast sailing downwind.  All sails are in good condition (UK Halsey) and the gennaker is new in 2017. Construction is fiberglass with epoxy foam with upgraded carbon fiber cross beams and high stress areas and was designed by Alan Carwardine and built by Roger Diggelmann.

name: oasis
description:
Little introduction is needed for this well-presented Peter Snell designed sailing cat, aptly named “Oasis”. She is ready and waiting for her new home. 
“Sarah” is one of the newest designs from the Peter Snell designed catamarans and named after his daughter Sarah. 
At 12 metres, it’s still able to be powered by 2x high thrust 9.9hp Yamaha outboards. 
The Easy Sarah features a high chine above the waterline. 
The overall beam of this boat is the same as the 11.6, but the width is carried lower in the hull, resulting in more space at hip level inside the hulls. The hull flares just above the waterline are deeper at the bow than previous Easy designs with the stern longer and wider. 
This boat also offers an even more protected cockpit than the others. 
Still manageable single-handed or short-handed, the gear is perfect for two people. 
The current Owners have prepared a video for you to view “Oasis” on a recent voyage, enjoy! 
One of my favourite things about this boat is her superb protected cockpit. 
Key features are: 
 
 Queen bed portside with walk in wardrobe/storage. 
 Good sailing performance and setup. 
 Versatile galley with plenty of bench space. 
 Many storage spaces.

name: equinox
description: Maestro Owner Version - 3 cabinsNew Sails 2018

Catamaran Fountaine Pajot Lipari 41 in very good condition for sale. Registered under Croatian company and flag. Used for personal use since 2016. 
Additional equipment: - 2 x Eberspächer heating system for all cabins 4kW - Solar panels 2x100W - Brand new dinghy (ZAR mini AIR 8) with outboard engine - 12V to 220V inverter - New stereo system with external speakers and CD/MP3/USB - New batteries - LED lights 
For further information please contact our office.

Lavezzi 40 Maestro-2004, launched 2005. 2 private owners, and has never been in charter. Professionally maintained catamaran with excellent sailing characteristcs.  
Lavezzi 40 Maestro (owner's version with 3-cabins), was constructed in late 2004 (launched 2005) by the Fountaine Pajot shipyard. Professionally maintained catamaran with excellent sailing characteristics. European VAT has been paid. This boat have seen very little use due to lac of time, she have spend 7 years on land and the last 6 years with total of 30 nights on board. The boat is like new inside and outside, with numerous upgrades made the passed 3 years.   
Accommodation  
The implementation of this Lavezzi is the master version with large aft cabin in the starboard hull with large toilet and shower, the location of the kitchen means that there is direct contact with the other passengers at the dining table outside. Saloon is with large dining table or can be converted as extra double bed, port hull is with 2 double cabins and separate toilet/shower, This catamaran is very atmospheric and very complete. The deck layout is very practical and in and around the cockpit you can walk around freely without obstacles. The lounge seat under the bimini on the aft deck provides plenty of space for six people. 2 x Yanmar 27 hp diesel 3 cylinder engines, in excellent condition, 2-bladed foldable props, fuel tank 250 liters.  
Fountaine Pajot catamarans are built for more than 35 years in France and have sailed more than 2500 round the world. They are very well known worldwide as a reliable A-brand and have dealers everywhere. They also have a 24-hour service for spare parts. It is an easy to catamaran with plenty of deck and walking space.

name: thida samut
description: British designed and built, Prout Catamarans help shape the foundations for todays modern cruising catamarans. In 2014 this boat underwent a major refit including engine replacement and a new compact 6KVA generator with auxiliary 180 litre diesel tank. Since then Thida has been used to cruise extensively throughout SEA before returning to OMYC in May 2018. She has performed wonderfully throughout this extended cruise often completing three to four day single handed passages. Her easy to handle rig allows all sailing adjustment (except gennacker) to be performed without leaving the cockpit, and cruising at 6 knots on one 75HP engine is more economical than using the original two 29HP engines to obtain the same speed. Under sail the twin KIWI feathering props allow a comfortable 7 – 8 knots to be maintained with a maximum speed of around 9 – 10 knots under ideal conditions.

ACTUALIZACIÓN: motor estribor, baterias, fondeo y placas solares nuevas 2017 
Tratamiento preventivo anti-ósmosis realizado en el 2011. 
Jarcia, velas y motores cambiados en el 2008.

The boat is very equipped in terms of comfort and leisure, with quality mattresses and box springs and all the equipment for a successful holiday: barbecue, plancha, paddle, kayak, electric autonomy. 
Equipped with a complete equipment, in an irreproachable state, she is a very beautiful opportunity to seize.

name: on y va
description:
ON Y VA is a a highly sought after 3 cabin owners version Fountaine Pajot Lavezzi 40, with an impressive inventory offering buyers the opportunity to enjoy immediate blue water cruising adventures. 
  
ON Y VA is a rare opportunity to own one of the most successful catamaran models in Fountaine Pajot’s history, carefully maintained and upgraded by three fastidious owners. 
  
This boat has the optional grey interior which perfectly compliments the open view and like-new timber finishes. The additional locker spaces and inner spring mattress in this owners version create a comfortable home which has served the current owners cruising the east coast for the last four years. 
  
Being setup as an on-water home means items such as expresso coffee machine and microwave oven are standard, as is the Eno gas top and oven. 
  
The timber interior is in near-factory condition due to smart use of block out curtains which have avoided the sun washed look many similar boats exhibit. The lounge cushions and covers were new in 2016 and provide easy cleaning and comfort around the modified lounge table. 
  
Sailing performance is enhanced by the factory fitted prodder and furling gennaker which was pulled out of the bag brand new 4 years ago, despite being shipped when the boat was launched. This is a testament to how little use this boat has had and it is also reflected in the quality of the cruising main and furling headsail.  
  
Cruising at 6-8 knots in 10-15 knots of  wind speed means easy distance on a daily basis. The Furuno plotter, radar and sounder provide easy control of this excellent boat. 
  
Current owners replaced the targa and canvas factory bimini with a new custom hardtop in 2015. This enhanced the steering position by lifting the headroom by 200mm (without loss of sail area), making the boat even more spacious and manageable. The led light fittings are three position switches to supply red lighting for night transits and bright white for anchorage dining and relaxing. 
  
Solar panels were replaced in 2016 with 200w panels coupled to an MPPT controller, delivering 15 amp of charge even on slightly overcast days. The boat draws little current with attention paid to led lights throughout, and low voltage equipment, including the Vesper AIS. 
  
At the same time, a custom kayak rack provides safe and easy ‘toy’ storage, as well a convenient towel rail for the external hot shower! Great for a quick rinse following the morning swim. 
  
Delivering outstanding performance in offshore conditions, the Lavezzi 40 also succeeds in being an extremely safe, comfortable and elegantly designed catamaran. 
  
Ideally suited to new boat buyers, ON Y VA will immediately appeal to those seeking a spacious catamaran with galley up, owners version, hard top bimini and much much more. She promises carefree cruising in local or blue water destinations, with all creature comforts to accommodate couples or families in style. 
  
The Lavezzi 40 has been hailed as the benchmark for cruising catamarans with its innovative layout, advanced technology and superior offshore handling. The catamaran features an extremely open and airy saloon with an aft facing semi-circular galley. 
  
A large opening hatch combined with the off-centre door transforms the galley into an integral part of the cockpit; one level from the time you step up from the transom. The layout is a superb advantage in Australia’s warmer climate. 
  
With waterproof cushions and a slightly smaller custom cockpit table, the cockpit space is perfect for entertaining. If the need arises the original table for cockpit and lounge come with the boat to extend back to factory original. This would suit the supplied mattresses to turn either lounge or cockpit into a comfortable day or overnight bed. 
  
ON Y VA has been competitively priced to meet the current market and requires no further expenditure. This is an outstanding catamaran that is ready to set sail and delight her new owners. She presents like new!

This catamaran is a market leader yet highly practical and easy to use. The boat is well thought out with a large hard top cockpit bimini, providing excellent shade and weather protection. An additional raised hardtop over the helm gives a 360 degree view for those at the helm. Solar panels were installed on the hardtop to charge the on-board batteries. 
Below the boat accommodates two double cabins and one spacious head while the starboard hull is allocated solely to a coveted owners suite featuring a large double cabin to aft and generous WC and separate shower in the fore-peak.  
The exterior is equally well thought out, with a large cockpit hardtop providing excellent shade and weather protection and an additional raised hardtop roof over the helm giving 360 degree views for those on the helm.

name: kool kat
description:
New listing Aug 2018 
At one time the Catana catamarans built in this era were the ones to have! Built using Twaron Carbon Fiber for weight saving making a light, fast catamaran with the benefit of daggerboards giving an unbelievable shallow draft that could sail in a puddle and enabling the catamaran to get much closer to the wind. 
With her unique “tulip” style hulls cutting through the water effortlessly added to this already great performers abilities 
A unique safety feature promoted by Catana was that in steep seas the catamaran could slide down a wave sideways without tripping on the keels. 
Unlike many of the production catamarans at the time, these performance cruisers offered better build quality and came with many optional extras included in the sale. 
Size wise this boat is an ideal Mediterranean cruiser, small enough to get into shallow berths in marinas and bays where others fear to tread, but equally a competent ocean crosser taking you wherever you want to be. 
This is a rare weapon and ready for new adventures on the high seas! This one will not stick around!

Catalyst sailed from the Admiral Yacht factory in Cape Town to the U.S. in 2001.  The current owners are the second owners and have followed in the original owners footsteps, spending considerable time and money to outfit her properly, and care for her impeccably. She is well equipped, in perfect mechanical order, and looks lovely. 
She is a four cabin, two central head, galley-up version of this popular catamaran with the current owners converting the forward port cabin into a great workshop/storeroom.  They have updated her along the way to make her a most comfortable, well set up cruising catamaran perfect for a couple or small family. The Admiral 38 is a very large 38 footer - she has high volume hulls, great beam, and a really spacious salon, as well as aft cockpit. Of the cats in this size range the Admiral is the most "ocean going" in my view - these cats are capable of sailing around the world, not only because they have large payload capacity, but great free-board, solid construction, and powerful Spar-craft rigsReady for new owners!!!

description:
Leopard Catamarans introduces the 2010 Leopard 38 No Charge. Located in Coconut Grove (Miami), very well maintained with several nice upgrades. Duty Paid, this one is priced to sell, shows well, turnkey ready. 
2010 ROBERTSON AND CAINE - Leopard 38 - No Charge 
BUILDERS REMARKS: The performance driven Leopard 38 is at the heart of the Leopard line. With her generous sail plan and stepped hull design, this yacht provides excellent performance. On deck, the space is well thought out and useable; from the large transoms to the open and spacious aft, side and forward decks, getting around this yacht is easy and safe. The hardtop bimini over the cockpit provides superior protection from the elements and also offers a stable working platform. 
BROKERS REMARKS: No Charge is offered with four double cabins, two head layout which gives plenty of room for group or families, plus additional fore-peak berths ideal for small children or simply extra storage. With sheets all run to the helm, electric winch at helm, and reliable under motor with Yanmar engines, anyone looking for a mid-size cat will find this yacht attractive. This yacht underwent a complete phase-out (refit) by Sunsail in 2016.

No Charge is wired and plumbed for a generator, she has a new rig (2016), and owner installed Victron Charger / Inverter, a new A/C unit, fresh water foot pump in the galley, new engine starters, a new Raymarine Evolution Autopilot, and fuel polishing / transfer system by Gulf Coast Filters. name: asgard
description:

Lagoon 380 sailing catamaran just arrived San Diego, California. Preowned catamaran for sale. Asgard is a beautiful 2002 Lagoon catamaran located in sunny San Diego, California. An Owner's Version catamaran, that is proven to be both safe and stable. the Lagoon 380 sailing catamaran with catamaran bottom job recently completed. The catamaran owner recently spent 100K+ in catamaran upgrades making this used Lagoon 380 catamaran a rare Southern California find. Upgrades to this Lagoon 380 catamaran include a new catamaran hard top, custom catamaran countertops, electric catamaran stove, 16K BTU catamaran air conditioning and 110V electrical system. name: nina
description:
For Sale a beautiful 2009 Andaman Cabriolet 38 two master cabin sailing catamaran currently in your favourite cruising destination, Thailand. Built by the well know Composite Catamarans, Nina has a racing record to be envied. 
As one of the first of the lightweight Phuket racing/cruising designs Nina led the evolution of these lightweight yet very liveable and charter ready catamarans. Equipped with a Cabriolet roof you can slide back and enjoy the stars at night feeling all the cooling breezes.  She is a 2 master ensuite design plus a Saloon table that can be converted to sleep a few others when required. Solar Panels keep her energy levels topped up and an good size inverter means you can keep your 240v items at hand. 
Tiller steering is another great feature for those racing types and she has been successfully raced over many years with easy access sailing controls. 
Relax watching the tropical sunsets under the sliding roof with friends and family around one of the world premier cruising grounds. She’ll sleep 8 in comfort with space for visitors for those dinner parties afloat. 
She has undergone a light refurbishment with a hull colour change to off-white and is now the best small cat in the region, whether it’s racing or cruising in comfort at a budget price. 
Please contact Multihull Solutions Asia office for more information and see below to download the inventory on this well laid out multihull. 
"Delivery to Australia can be arranged for an extra fee"

She is designed for short hand sailing, with a two speed electric winch at the helm, and all control lines leading to the helm. She has been given the best care and maintenance by her one owner.Fully equipped for extensive cruising with watermaker, solar & wind generators, radar, AIS, GPS, chartplotter, good refrigeration, spinnaker, etc.

name: necessity
description:
available now and newly listed. This 2010 Spirited 380 represents a great opportunity for a sailor looking for a fast and robust cruising catamaran.  
She has been owned by an experienced multihuller who is considering upgrading to a larger cat. 
NECESSITY is a 2010 Spirited 380 designed by Craig Schionning. Pro built in the USA by the renowned Jim Betts boat yard in WA she is already imported and can even be chartered (no Jones Act). NECESSITY is a true Sport Cruiser and ideal for sailors looking for a spacious catamaran that sails well and is easy to maintain. This Spirited 380 has great seakeeping, speed, and a very practical protected layout. She features modern, easily driven hulls, a proper bridgedeck clearance, daggerboards, and protected twin helms. Owners report very fast secure crossings. Inside she's a very practically appointed owner's version. The owner's hull sports a queen sized bed, walk-in closet, and ensuite head. Guests enjoy another queen cabin and an aft double cabin with a head forward. Her galley is up and central and her salon is ergonomic and comfortable.  
An incredible bargain. Brand new very popular Spirited 380 design built to a very high standard has a good balance of fresh modern styling, excellent sailing performance and generous amount of internal volume for a good functional layout. Fitted out for genuine cruising in style with the comforts of home expected on a boat of this size. L shape Galley Up layout for easy entertaining in the spacious saloon and undercover cockpit. Folding davits with swimming platform/duckboard the width of the boat. Two queen and 1 double cabins for privacy for all aboard. Twin Volvo 18hp saildrive diesels for reliability and ease of manoeuvring complimented by a good choice of deck hardware for durability and ease of use. Ideal for new boat buyer looking for a top quality cruising cat.

name: nina
description:
This latest design was made specifically for easier sailing by a crew with modest experience, with particular reference to the charter market and those who sail only occasionally. With the new rig being 3m shorter than the original design and 60cm narrower in the beam, the boat can be sailed comfortably and safely by two persons. 
Despite these modifications, the design caters for those who like to mix some racing with their cruising. The hull design is sleek with very little rocker so it doesn't drag water. Because of the impact on the buoyancy of the hull design, weight is a key factor but despite some material modifications to the original design for strength and durability, the Andaman Cabriolet still weighs in at just 3,000Kgs lightships (racing trim). 
Another special feature of the boat is its retractable saloon roof. The Andaman Cabriolet's wide open, spacious saloon and cockpit gives the option of sailing 'al fresco' for all on board, without crowding in the cockpit area or being cut off in the saloon from the action. 
At the same time, the saloon can be sealed off from the elements with the retractable saloon roof and side screens, perfect for those times when you have extra guests on board using the drop down saloon table/extra berth configuration. 
The vessel has recently undergone extensive refitting, including a rebuild of both motors and a full paint job. With this refit and the recent price reduction (March 2018), it makes her an extraordinary value. It won’t be on the market long, so inquire for more information and schedule a time to take a look. More photos and videos are available.

description:
Pau Hana has been extremely well cared for and meticulously maintained by very thorough and knowledgeable owners. She's an owner’s version (3 cabins/2 heads) that is set up for live-aboard cruising, with well over $50K in upgrades and modifications in the past 2 years. This includes a custom hardtop with side curtains and front dodger, cockpit cushions, salon cushions, air conditioner, electric heads and 200 feet of anchor chain.  Also includes new furler, standing rigging, running rigging, custom lazy jack, Lewmar hatch shades and more. 
Although a 2000 year Leopard model, she shows like a much newer boat that has been carefully maintained by prior owners.  She was in charter for less than 6 months and as a result did not experience the wear and tear normally associated with a charter boat. She is a blue water capable boat and has crossed the Atlantic several times.  The boat offers the following:

BROKERS REMARKS: "She Loves Me" has been well cared for by original owners and professional yachtsmen.. She has new Doyle sails (2015) and Stak Pak, new trampoline, new Raymarine e120s with 24 nm Radar, 400 Watts of Solar,  Wind Generator, 3x Anchors, Dinghy and 15hp OB included as part of equipment (no title).   
BUILDERS REMARKS: The Leopard 38 (or Moorings 3800) is the one of the rare "owners layout". The 38 handles easily, has a large cockpit and a well appointed saloon and cabins. This is the three double cabin version with a master suite occupying the starboard hull and the two cabins in the port hull share heads and showers. The galley is up in the saloon. The deck layout is clear and the mainsheet traveller runs on an arch over the transom giving unimpeded access to the water via a wide aft bathing platform. The transom arch also serves to support the aft end of the bimini and to carry the dinghy. Deep louvre steps shade the forward sloping saloon windows while providing an easy and secure walkway to the saloon roof. The Leopard 38 is a competent performer under sail and power.

This 2001 Lightwave 38 is designed by the world renowned Tony Grainger, and has to be one of the most intelligent "under 40-foot" cats ever designed or built. This explains why they were so popular in Australia, and why they cost much more to build than the typical production catamaran. She offers superior lightweight foam core construction with solid vinyl ester resin below the waterline.  
From 2004 to 2013, First Light had wintered on the hard under her cover. She was used lightly during the Summer seasons. First Light is Hull #9 in the very popular LW38 series built by Lightwave Yachts in Australia and boasts a voluminous and comfortable interior with tons of storage. Her smart salon design, excellent galley-down that remains open to the salon, her owner's berth, large standing shower, etc., set her apart from most other 38' catamaran options. She even sports excellent underwing clearance, so she will not only be faster underway (owner has sailed her at 21kts), but will not pound or bang like so many other catamarans. 
First Light has been well-cared for by her previous and current owners. She was originally owned in Cape Coral, FL, when her second owner purchased her and moved her to New York. Her second owner was a surgeon, who spared no expense in caring for her with special attention to detail. When her current owner, an engineer and USCG Captain, purchased her in 2013, he followed suit. It is CLEAR that this boat has been maintained to near perfection, and you do NOT want to miss your chance to see her. The current owner sailed her down the East US Coast and around to Tampa Bay, where she currently resides. He is ready to move onto his next yachting adventure, and needs to find her a new home. 
Call me today to set up an appointment, and be prepared to be amazed!

name: wanderlust
description:
“CURRENT PRICE” IS A GUIDE.  ALL OFFERS RESPECTFULLY CONSIDERED. 
General Description  LEOPARD 48 GENERAL INFORMATION, AKA-Moorings 4800, as presented in the "Robertson and Caine International Yacht Pty Ltd." Owner's Manual, the following specifications will give you an idea of the yacht dimensions. This VARIES from year to year, but in general all are very similar.   Built on the success of the popular Moorings 4600 Catamaran, the all-new Moorings 4800 was designed in collaboration between The Moorings, architects Simonis-Voogd and builders Robertson & Caine.   Offering excellent performance under sail and state of the art amenities, this yacht is the perfect vacation platform - ideal for 8 guests. Guests will enjoy a number of luxury amenities including a large forward cockpit with access to the main salon; an all-new design element that will be available for the first-time ever on a Moorings yacht!   The expansive main cabin features a full entertainment center, plush U-shaped settee, and large dining table - all surrounded by windows offering 360-degree views of your beautiful surroundings. The private guest staterooms are luxurious, bright, and airy with double beds, plenty of storage space for everything from swimsuits to evening attire, and en-suite lavatories with electric flushing toilets and enclosed stall showers.   Since the yacht has a powerful generator sleeping in air-conditioned comfort, while experiencing the wonders of a tropical paradise, is assured. The modern kitchen is second to none, with all that's needed to prepare gourmet meals, which can be served at the table in the large cockpit, shaded under a hardtop roof - the perfect setting for an al fresco dining experience or cocktails!   The deck layout of a Moorings 4800 is ideally suited for relaxing, sunbathing, and swimming from the two wide platforms at the rear of the yacht. A cross deck connects the two hulls, providing even more space to enjoy water sports of every kind, including kayaking, stand-up paddle boarding and snorkeling.   The large deck area, at the bow, is an enchanting place to enjoy the quiet wash of the gentle waves against the hull as you sail the yacht to yet another exciting destination. Designed and built exclusively for The Moorings, the 4800 ranks as one of the finest charter yachts in the world!  Actual Condition This is one of the boats where the hulls are in good condition, with mostly only scratches and some gouges. The starboard engine was submerged and the port only 1/2 wet, but has some parts missing.   The condition of the generator is unknown. There are 2 sails, a boom and a broken mast. The electrical panel appears usable. There isn't a stove, and the condition of the fridge is unknown. The props and rudders appear good. It looks like only 1 of the air-conditioners got wet. Only 1 side got wet, and you can see the stains in the heads as to how high the water got.  
A VERY REPAIRABLE BOAT... Look closely at the photos and they will tell the story.  
Inspect before making and offer and a minimum bank wired deposit is required with your offer.  *We always encourage potential Buyers to view the item personally or have someone else inspect it for you prior making an offer. It is entirely the buyer's responsibility to inspect and determine the vessel's actual condition.

name: private party
description:
Well presented 4 cabin, galley up version, ‘Private Party’ was built in South Africa by Robertson and Caine. Their strong build quality and ocean sailing capabilities make this catamaran a self-sufficient blue-water cruiser. 
Private Party was placed into the Moorings in Hamilton Island for 3 years after her build. She was then refurbished in 2014/15 including new Yanmar engines only( 108 HRS) and antifouled in 2018.  She is now located at our Multihull Solutions Gold Coast Sales centre at The Boat Works in Coomera Gold Coast. 
The hulls are built of GRP construction with balsa core and solid glass along the centreline, for strength of structure as well as insulation. The innovative stepped hull design increases volume while minimizing the wetted hull surface, giving exceptional load carrying capacity and maximum performance for its size and weight. Fixed skegs protect the rudders, also offering excellent attachment points for the rudder shaft. The vessel can easily be beached. 
The Leopard is well set up for living onboard with 4 cabins, a roomy saloon and spacious cockpit for entertaining family and friends.

name: sonra
description:
For Sale: Sonra, a spectacular, well proven, well sorted, Fusion 40 sailing catamaran. She is that ‘one-of-a-kind’ you hear about. Built by The Cat Factory as their Demo catamaran, she showcased the companies’ exemplary boat building abilities in light strong catamarans.  As a Fusion Approved builder, The Cat Factory produced many other high-performance catamarans and was well respected for build quality in Australia.  
Sonra has the equipment required for extended cruising, is strong and lightweight, so when you arrive you can race around the cans with success. The South East Asian circuit beckons and Sonra is ready to go. 
Extremely well laid out using the best Fusion experience, along with the builders’ expertise, this shining example of the design has had her features copied in other Fusion 40’s. Her interior look is clean, uncluttered and sophisticated with a quality well above most. Recent new Solar panels and an up rated Inverter mean proper coffee can be brewed.  
She is currently on the west coast of Australia and can be sold with a berth, should she be required to locate to the east, a delivery crew can be organised to make re-location arrangements.  
Please see below in the Multihull Solutions webpage her complete inventory and make an offer on or close to asking and she can be yours. For more information, please contact Charles Robinson on the team at Multihull Solutions.
Lagoon 39 2014 for sale in Alicante, Spain / Berth possibilities / Four cabins accommodation / Priced to sell.

name: deep blue
description:
She is one of the finest examples of a Lagoon 39 2015. Beautifully maintained in excellent condition and fitted full extras. Commercially registered with full safety equipment and a busy charter schedule operated by a professional yachting team. 
The interior and upholstery is of luxurious standards and has been kept and maintained in great condition.  
Fitted with B&G Navigational equipment, Plotter, chain counter, electric toilets, autopilot, solar panels  , gangway and many more. Ask us for details. 
  
Deck & CockpitCockpit table, cockpit seat & sunbed cushions, cockpit stereo loudspeakers, electric anchor windlass, swimming ladder, cockpit shower, boat hook, winch handles, dinghy, pump, oars, plastic bucket, diesel jerrycan, engine oil, fuel funnel, deckbrush, gas bottles, spare anchor, fenders, mooring lines 
Sails & RiggingFurling self-tacking jib, batten main sail, reefing lines led to cockpit, large bimini, sprayhood, lazy jacks & bag 
SafetyLife raft, VHF, GMDSS, fire extinguishers, life jackets, torch light, bosun's chair, black ball, horseshoe lifebuoy, floating light, emergency helm, safety belts, box of flares, first aid kit, fog horn, hand bilge pump and handle, boat's manuals 
NavigationGPS plotter, autopilot, speed log, echo sounder, wind instruments, cockpit compass, hand bearing comp, divider, parallel ruler, Greek waters pilot, charts, clock, binoculars, extra anchor controller by the steering wheel 
Galley 
Gas stove & oven, electric fridge and freezer, cutlery - kitchen equipment, pots & pans, plates, glasses  
Spares & ToolsEngines ' spare impellers, belts, filters ,dinghy repair kit, toolbox 
Comfort 
Solar panel, hot water boiler, fans in cabins and saloon, Stereo CD/MP3 player

Le Lipari 41 a été conçu et voulu par le chantier Fountaine Pajot comme un catamaran de grande croisière : confortable, volumineux et performant. Celui-ci est en version Propriétaire 3 cabines. La suite occupe toute la coque tribord, tandis que les deux autres cabines sont sur bâbord. Les deux cabines arrière sont dotées de larges baies apportant luminosité et ventilation grâce à un hublot ouvrant. De nombreux rangements, tiroirs et penderies viennent compléter ces espaces. Le carré, design, lumineux et fonctionnel, peut accueillir jusqu’à 8 personnes. Il comporte une belle cuisine en L équipée et ouverte sur le cockpit, tandis que la table à carte, facilement accessible du poste de barre, est disposée dans le sens de la navigation pour un confort maximal. 
Ce Lipari possède en outre un parc de 9 batteries, 2 chauffages et un équipement électronique particulièrement complet.

name: fau
description:
FAUis a 2013 Dolphin 42 Ocema that was built to very high standards in northern Brazil by Dolphin Catamarans. 
The owners had the boat built and have enjoyed 5 years of wonderful cruising from Brazil to the BVI's and everywhere in between. The boat is presently in Bocos del Toros, Panama and a very much for sale. 
The owners have been extremely pleased with both the boats sailing abilities and the level of construction quality. 
Fau features: 
Low hours on both engines 
Generator 
Air conditioning 
Good electronics 
Dinghy and outboard 
4 staterooms/ 2 heads 
And much more!
